title: Fairly heavy rains expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, Southern and Uva provinces and in Ampara, Batticaloa and Polonnaruwa districts during the afternoon or night today (17).

title: US tariffs to strain sovereign credit in Asia-Pacific; Sri Lanka vulnerable – Fitch
byline: Fitch Ratings says that the increased US tariffs will weigh on the credit metrics of many sovereigns in the Asia-Pacific, with Sri Lanka likely to be among the affected states when country-specific tariffs are eventually implemented.

title: VAT exempted on locally produced milk and yogurt; digital services and traders face new tax changes
byline: The Inland Revenue Department (IRD) announced that locally produced liquid milk and yogurt are now exempted from Value Added Tax (VAT), following the enactment of the Value Added Tax (Amendment) Bill.

title: Final New Year ritual observed today; Special transport services in operation
byline: The final ritual of the Sinhala and Tamil New Year, leaving for work, is being observed today (17) at the auspicious time of 9.03 a.m.

title: Boat catches fire in Congo and capsizes, leaving at least 50 people dead, hundreds missing
byline: A boat has capsized after catching fire in northwestern Congo, leaving at least 50 people dead and hundreds missing, a local official said on Wednesday.

title: Maldives bars travelers with Israeli passports over Gaza war
byline: The Maldives has changed its immigration law to bar people from entering the country with Israeli passports in a show of outrage over the war in Gaza.

title: E-filing of VAT returns mandated from July 2025
byline: The Inland Revenue Department (IRD) says that all Value Added Tax (VAT) returns must be filed electronically from July 01, 2025.

title: ‘Home Alone 2’ director fears deportation if he cuts Trump cameo
byline: During an interview with San Francisco Chronicle, Chris Columbus shared that he wishes he could remove Donald Trump’s cameo from Home Alone 2: Lost in New York.

title: 6 injured as three-wheeler and bus collide in Dickoya; Schoolboy critical
byline: A total of six individuals travelling in a three-wheeler were injured in a collision with a private bus near Dickoya town on the Hatton–Maskeliya main road.

title: 400,000 more families to get Aswesuma benefits from June – President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake announced in Mannar that the government will extend the ‘Aswesuma’ welfare benefits program to an additional 400,000 families starting in June this year.

title: China bans ‘smart’ and ‘autonomous’ driving terms from vehicle ads
byline: China is banning automakers from using the terms “smart driving” and “autonomous driving” when they advertise driving assistance features, and it will tighten scrutiny of such technology upgrades.

title: 18 candidates arrested for violating election laws so far
byline: 18 candidates contesting the 2025 Local Government (LG) Election have been arrested in connection with election-related complaints over the period spanning March 3 to April 16.

title: Apple users urged to update devices immediately after sophisticated attack
byline: Apple has released iOS 18.4.1 and it comes with a warning to update your iPhone now.

title: Gold prices surge in Sri Lanka
byline: The price of gold in the world market has reached its highest level in history.

title: No special queues for VIPs at Sacred Tooth Relic exposition – Police
byline: Deputy Inspector General of Police for the Kandy and Matale Districts, Sudath Masinghe, says that no special queues will be arranged for VIPs or VVIPs during the upcoming exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic, which is scheduled to begin tomorrow (April 18) at the Sri Dalada Maligawa in Kandy.

title: Scientists find strongest evidence yet of life on an alien planet
byline: In a potential landmark discovery, scientists using the James Webb Space Telescope have obtained what they call the strongest signs yet of possible life beyond our solar system, detecting in an alien planet’s atmosphere the chemical fingerprints of gases that on Earth are produced only by biological processes.

title: EC revises postal voting dates for LG elections
byline: The Election Commission has revised the dates for postal voting in the upcoming Local Government Elections.

title: 187 complaints received regarding bus services during festive season
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) stated that it had received 187 complaints from passengers concerning bus services operated during the Sinhala and Tamil New Year festive season.

title: Warm weather advisory issued for several provinces, districts
byline: A warm weather advisory has been issued for residents of the Northern, North-central, North-western, Western, Southern and Eastern provinces and in Rathnapura and Monaragala districts.

title: Special security measures to be implemented for Easter Sunday
byline: Sri Lanka Police Headquarters has announced that steps have been taken to implement a special security program in view of the upcoming Easter Sunday celebrations.

title: Welikada custodial death: Youth’s body to be exhumed for new post-mortem
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court today ordered the exhumation of the body of Nimesh Sathsara, a youth who died while in police custody following his arrest by the Welikada Police.

title: Teenage boy dies after fall from greased pole in Elpitiya
byline: A 16-year-old schoolboy has died after falling from a greased pole (Lissana Gaha) while preparing it for the Aluth Avurudu (New Year) celebrations that was scheduled to be held in the Elpitiya area today (17).

title: Sri Lanka records over 800,000 tourist arrivals so far in 2025
byline: The number of tourists who arrived in the country in the first fifteen days of April stood at 93,915, according to the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA).

title: Tri-forces chiefs directed to boost security for Easter Sunday
byline: The Secretary of Defence, Air Vice Marshal Sampath Thuyacontha (Retd) has instructed the Tri-Forces Commanders to beef up security in the country in liaison with the Ministry of Public Security for Easter Sunday on April 20, Ministry of Defence announced.

title: New website launched for real-time updates on ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’
byline: Sri Lanka Police has introduced a special traffic management and guidance system for the upcoming exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic (‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’), which is scheduled to begin tomorrow (April 18) at the Sri Dalada Maligawa in Kandy.

title: Youth injured in shooting at Ahungalla
byline: A 28-year-old youth has been shot and injured following a shooting incident near a school in Ahungalla, police said.
